data.title: Awesome Experience!
data.text: My husband and I recently went on this tour for a second time with some out of town guests who were visiting us and it was just as amazing but a completely different experience as the first time. This is an awesome experience whether you are visiting from out of town or are a local. It is a great way to get to sample a little bit (really a lot) from a handful (or more) of the restaurants downtown all at one time. Both times we took the tour, we left completely stuffed and in no need of dinner that evening. We also cannot say enough good things about the tour guide, Brian. He does a great job organizing the tour and interacting with the group.

data.title: Nearly 5 Stars - Highly recommend!
data.text:
Great list of quality restaurants, easy walking and our guide was knowledgable about his community.  Our guide acknowleged the misfortune that two restaurants served the same items and I'm sure that will be addressed.  Our final restaurant was a disappointment - a small chicken wing and room temperature water by an unhappy waiter.  Again, I think that will be addressed as well. 
That said - go hungry and plan to have a good time.

data.title: Great Experience
data.text: I really enjoyed my time ,food,meeting new people and the tour conductor which she was very friendly and knowledgeable.Highly recommend for couples and group outing.

data.title: Columbia Food Tour
data.text: The tour was outstading! We were stuffed when it was all over and found some amazing food choices in Columbia! Thanks so much cant wait for a Lexington tour!

data.title: Great event for dates or friend outings!
data.text: This was so wonderful that I'm going back two weeks later with my friend! I went originally as a date with a long distance boyfriend, but am taking a friend lest week because I enjoyed it so much. The food is delicious and you'll eat so much you won't need dinner that night. Also, the military discount is so great!

data.title: Lots of good food!
data.text: Easy location to group together. Great food, friendly guide, easy route to walk. Business owners or management happy to see everyone and were well prepared for the group.

data.title: Great afternoon tour of Main Street food
data.text: Great mix of restaurants and plenty of food. Brian was great and we met some new people and now have some new places to eat and drink in Columbia. I would highly recommend this tour and what a great deal for the price and all of the delicious food.

data.title: New food for the locals!
data.text:
I have lived in the Columbia area for 27 years and was excited to find out we had a food tour. My husband and I went and loved it! You get to taste great food and you also get to hear some of the history of downtown Columbia!

This was my Facebook post the evening of our tour...

We went on our food tour today with Columbia Food Tours and had a great time. We went to Fresh Squeezed, a cold press juicing company, Midlands in the Marriott, which had awesome food and lots of it! The shrimp and grits were so good. We then went to Villa Tronco, The Oak Table, Persona Pizza, and Bourbon. It was neat to hear the history at Villa Tronco and the Chipotle Chicken pizza at Persona was great. We went back after the tour and got one to go 🐷 All the food was incredible. Our group was very personable and Brian our tour guide was fun and knows a lot of history. 

We were stuffed by the time we got to our last stop but wanted to start all over again!

We have since been to Persona again for takeout and went back to Southern Squeezed for their one day juice cleanse.

data.title: Great tour to get a glimpse of Downtown Columbia!
data.text: This was a great tour of downtown. Not only did we visit a variety of restaurants from casual to VERY nice, but we got a bit of history as well. I loved hearing about the city and the buildings. I did this on a date with my husband and the people made the experience that much more enjoyable! I got to leisurely walk the streets with my hubby, but met great people (who love food!) along the way! Lots of laughter and no hurried at all!

data.title: Yummy for the tummy with history bonus
data.text: Don't miss the Main St. tour with Brian! Had 5 stops at variety of his top picks that ranged from fine dining to pizzeria. Along the walks, Brian offered some pertinent history of the architecture and landmarks of the center city. Several of the restaurant owners also shared interesting histories of their places and families. I was on a sisters trip this round but would do this again with my entire family on next trip to Cola City.

data.title: Columbia Food Tours Adventure
data.text: We went to college in Columbia and had a great time revisiting the area! The Food Tour brought to light many places on Main Street was had never been too, but wished we had! We even went back to several of the restaurants during our weekend trip!

data.title: It was Fabulous
data.text: Even the hot  humid weather did not deter the enjoyment of this event. Restaurants are close enough together and there is enough shade to minimize the walking in the sun. Brian is a fun, relaxed guide and obviously very organized. All the places were ready for us and seemed genuinely happy to share a little history of their restaurant. And then the food: FABULOUS!. Lot's of variety for the 5 places we visited. At the end we were stuffed. Prepare yourself for some real southern fare. Shrimp and Grits (at Midlands) was the best I have ever tasted. I even liked the healthy juice bar samples though when I take a food tour, healthy is not what I have in mind. All of the food: gumbo, bacon wrapped scallop, cold pea soup with bacon and mint, authentic Italian pizza, fried green tomato, crab cake and more...was delicious.

data.title: Worth the effort
data.text: The guide was good,  the food was great at some places, pretty good at some places, and so-so at others. But it was a nice way to spend the afternoon with visitors from out of town, a way to get out of the house, have a meal, see a little bit of the nice part of town.

data.title: Columbia Food Tours
data.text: Great time! Enjoyed learning more about Columbia local restaurants and trying wonderful local cuisine! Worth attending!

data.title: The Best Food Tour
data.text: This is a must do! Brian, the tour guide and owner does a great job leading the tour. You will truly get a sampling of the different tastes of downtown Columbia as well as some history along the way. I am a foodie and this tour is a foodie's dream. Dont let the "sampling" talk scare you. You won't be hungry by the end of the tour. Go book a tour now!

data.title: Plenty of food...
data.text: First time doing a food tour.  I went with some friends.  In Columbia for just a few weeks.  Excellent way to spend a Saturday afternoon.  A lot of food!  I'm not a seafood guy, so I had to step out of my comfort zone.  But, I was pretty impressed.  You'll be offered meat, crab cake, shrimp and grits, pizza, cheesecake, fried green tomatoes, and bourbon.  Can't beat the price!  5 different spots.  Decent amount of walking (to burn off some calories).  It lasts around 3 hours?  Great way to also learn about Columbia.  Also a nice way to break the ice and meet some people in a casual environment.  If you buy a shirt, beware that they run very big.  I bought an XL and it's like a dress on me.

data.title: Overall an AMAZING experience!
data.text: I was very excited about the Columbia Food tour, and it by far exceeded my expectations!  It was a great experience and an even better way to get to know the food culture in Columbia!

data.title: Awesome Visit to Columbia
data.text:
If you are new in town and you love to eat, this is the way to get the inside scoop on amazing chefs in the area,cutting edge preparations, farm to table freshness, and good old fashioned southern hospitality.
5 stars!

C. Sarbo

data.title: My Food Tour
data.text:
I have to admit I was a little skeptical before I started this food experience whaling from the anxiety of a vile taste to never be forgotten or a sudden food allergy episode…but none of that!!! This food experience changed my life!!! The first stop on the tour was “Southern Squeeze” putting in your mind that you should always consider your health, which Southern Squeeze lets you do in a delicious way.  Please keep this healthy note in mind because what you’re about to experience is border line gluttonous, in a good way. 
Our next stop was in an unlikely location kind of a hidden gem, the “Midlands” located in the downtown Marriot. Yes! A hotel but don’t be so quick to judge because it promised a true southern south in your mouth and they did not disappoint. When you can finally stop swimming around in the bottom of that glass of peach sweet tea your pallet is greeted with a southern hug of tender ribs with a home-made sauce, chicken and waffles like none other, fried green tomatoes like you’re eating it I have to admit I was a little skeptical before I started this food experience whaling from the anxiety of a vile taste to never be forgotten or a sudden food allergy episode…but none of that!!! This food experience changed my life!!! The first stop on the tour was “Southern Squeeze” putting in your mind that you should always consider your health, which Southern Squeeze lets you do in a delicious way.  Please keep this healthy note in mind because what you’re about to experience is border line gluttonous, in a good way. 
Our next stop was in an unlikely location kind of a hidden gem, the “Midlands” located in the downtown Marriot. Yes! A hotel but don’t be so quick to judge because it promised a true southern south in your mouth and they did not disappoint. When you can finally stop swimming around in the bottom of that glass of peach sweet tea your pallet is greeted with a southern hug of tender ribs with a home-made sauce, chicken and waffles like none other, fried green tomatoes like you’re eating it off the vine and to top it off the most decadent bowl of shrimp n grits that every bite demands silence from others as you’re transported to a front porch swing on a perfect Carolina day. 
As we meander to out next location we take in the sites and listen to our guide enlighten us to some of the historical information that the area was founded on. So when you’re on the Columbia food tour, be sure to ask why there are 2 buildings chained together and furthermore who put it there? As well as take note of how many of the buildings bare this emblem “The National Register of Historic Places.”
The day was gorgeous and the weather perfect, so the walk from location to location was pleasant. Especially with the inclusion of live southern jams wafting through the air. One the next stop we were truly in for a treat, “Villa Tronco.”  This little quiet corner of the city is home to this World War II-era spot that is the oldest restaurant that can confirm continuous operation in a state that dates back to 1788. WOW!!! We were fortunate enough to hear this story from Mr. Martin himself over a slice of their authentic Italian pizza and Carmella’s original New York cheese cake?! You will NOT be disappointed.
There are a few more stops along the way each once leaving you speechless; only because you’ll have food in your mouth. I’ll close by talking about one more location that unless you take the food tour or you’re a member of the “Capital City Club” ….you’re not just strolling in to eat, drink and be merry. Chef Howard greeted us with a sample of quail as exquisite to the palate as the view was as tantalizing to the eyes. This alone is worth the trip to take the Columbia Food Tour. Thank you Brian you’ve made me realize all over again why I’m a Foodie.

data.title: Fun and Full
data.text: We had a blast! Great food and experience! We tried some new things, some old, and enjoyed it all. We definitely have some restaurants to go back to and try more of their menu in the future!
